title: How To Eat Healthy On A Budget
summary: Growing your own food is one of the best ways to save money, and it can also help you eat healthier. Shop the perimeter of the store where you will find fresh produce, healthy snacks, and whole grain items. Buy frozen and canned produce is still better than none at all. Bagged leafy greens are a lot cheaper than the fresh variety and taste just as good. Beans and lentils are cheap and full of vitamins that can be used in many recipes, and are great additions to soups and stews.
